TopicTitle: Minor set of new parts I'd like to see

Articles.Content:
I've been playing KSP for about a month now. I've recently started putting together a refuelling station in orbit and noticed a small set of parts which I think would get rid of a few frustrations I've had while not noticably altering the gameplay balance or mechanics.

1) A xenon tank similar in size to the FL-T200 Fuel Tank, with a capacity of ~8000 xenon. For a re-fuelling station, it's nice to have your fuel supply in as few containers as possible as it makes it easier to examine what you have and to perform fuel transfers. Instead of a handful of these I've attached 18 of the radial-mount ones to my space station.

2) Fuel/oxidizer canister of similar shape/size to the mystery-goo container or Stratus-V Cylindrified Monopropellant Tank. On occasion I'd like to be able to add a little bit extra fuel, though making the rocket taller isn't appropriate. Or I'd like to use it a tactically-placed counterweight for my SSTO refuelling plane.

3) Longer version of the Pegasus I Mobility Enhancer - perhaps 8 rungs worth. I like to run ladders along my space station to allow Kerbals to EVA with fuel. However, I have to put *lots* of these on to cover the length of my refuelling station. This is time consuming and leads to a lot of slightly-misaligned parts. Also, I've read that large numbers of parts on things can slow down the physics engine - this may be one way to reduce that.

4) Different-diameter versions of the Structural Fuselage. When trying to make an extended docking arm for my station I wanted a bit of clearance, so I used a stack of ~5 xenon canisters. One launch it bent like an accordion. Launch issues were addressed, though it would be nice to have a longer, ridged option for changing the lengths of things.
I'm not qualified yet to comment on 1,2,4 but 3 is a good idea, I've pretty much given up on ladders already and I'm still pretty low in the tech tree...you just have to place too many of them.

1 & 2 are in the KSPX pack, most of which has been added to the vanilla game already.
